job title: Sr. Scientist, Scientist Pharma Assays and Analytics
job description:
Description

LakePharma is a leading biologics company specializing in antibody and protein engineering, cell line development, and protein production. Our services can be fully integrated, creating a customized solution for all our customers molecular biology, cell line, and protein needs. We just raised $30m in growth equity from Summit Partners & Ampersand Capital Partners for expansion purposes.

We are rapidly growing and seeking a talented individual to join our Pharma Assays & Analytics department as a Senior Scientist / Scientist . The ideal candidate will have the ability to read and understand scientific literature, manage multiple projects and possess a positive can-do and enthusiastic attitude.

Job responsibilities will include the following:
  • Validate and Perform Cell-based and Enzyme-based assays and related procedures using manual and automated liquid handling equipment, including but not limited to:
    • - Enzyme Activity Analysis

    - Cytotoxicity Determination

    - Quantitative PCR Analysis

    - Radiometric Binding Analysis

    - High Content Cell Screening

    - Flow Cytometry
  • Participate in management of client projects from quote writing to final deliverables
  • Manage client-provided assay materials
  • Provide timely project updates and data reports to Project Manager or Client
  • Schedule work with internal resources to maximize efficiency and meet project timelines
  • Manage materials ordering for client projects
  • Provide oversight and mentorship of junior team members/contractors/interns
  • Participate in management of consumable inventory, service and maintenance of equipment
  • Assist with development of new service offerings and introduction of new equipment and/or techniques.
    • Requirements
  • MS/PhD in Biology/Biochemistry or related field with 5-7 years work experience
  • Proven experimental design skills a prerequisite
  • Plate-Based, manual liquid handling experience required, automation experience preferred
  • Cell culture/handling experience required and familiarity with IPSC and primary cells/experimental design preferred.
  • Competence in using Microsoft Excel/Statistics software for data analysis and competence in data analysis methodology
  • Attention to detail and ability to solve problems/troubleshoot
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, matrix environment without compromising quality or timelines
  • Can work independently and in a group setting
  • Can multi-task and is organized
  • Strong time management skills
    • This position provides a unique opportunity for a person with aspiration to join and contribute to a fast-paced team at a rapidly expanding company with ample opportunity to grow. If you have the drive, passion, experience and are excited by this opportunity and ready to take your career to the next level then Apply Today!
